bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Merritte W. Ireland, October 1, 1941

div1.p: Hench sends Ireland a copy of his "Hygeia" yellow fever article and three photographs of Kean and Ireland, one of which he wants autographed and returned.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Merritte W. Ireland, October 1, 1941
div1.opener:
October 1, 1941
General M. W. Ireland
1870 Wyoming Avenue N. W.
Washington, D. C.
My dear General Ireland:
div1.p:
Permit me to send you by separate post a copy
of the current Hygeia with my article on yellow fever in it.
I will shortly have many reprints available and will be glad
to send you as many as you wish. I am taking the liberty of
sending to General Kean an enlargement of the picture which
I took of you and him. I am sending him one for himself to
keep and with it one for you to keep and I am also taking
the liberty of asking him and you to autograph the third one
for myself. I shall be most proud to have this to hang in
my office. I am sending him the appropriate labels so that
you can return it to me with a minimum of trouble to yourself.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
